thread.title: It looks like Danny Baker's Cradle to Grave is returning for a second series - TV
thread.title_full: It looks like Danny Baker's Cradle to Grave is returning for a second series - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Morgan Jeffery
title: It looks like Danny Baker's Cradle to Grave is returning for a second series - TV
text: © BBC Danny Baker's autobiographical sitcom Cradle to Grave looks set to return for a second series.Though the BBC is yet to make an official announcement, outgoing director of television Danny Cohen may have let the news slip on Twitter.Thanks Danny. With Series Two commissioned all is well. Thank you for working with us on it! https://t.co/0RzCiEmKmz— Danny Cohen (@DannyCohen) October 13, 2015When Baker quipped that Cohen's "work is done" after commissioning his sitcom, he responded: "With Series Two commissioned all is well."Digital Spy has reached out to the BBC for comment. © BBC/ ITV Cradle Ltd/Matt Squire Based on Baker's memoirs, Cradle to Grave stars Laurie Kynaston as a young Danny, with Peter Kay adopting a cockney accent to play the boy's father Fred.The 8-part first series wrapped with a double-bill on October 15 on BBC Two.Danny Baker defends Peter Kay's cockney accent in Cradle to GraveRebecca Root hopeful about Boy Meets Girl series two: 'I hope the BBC is proud of the show'Watch a clip from Cradle to Grave below:
